itemDescription: Welsh rugby league and rugby union footballer

wikipedia_page.main: Jon Breakingbury (born 5 October 1982) is a professional rugby league and rugby union footballer. He played representative level rugby league (RL) for Wales, and at club level for Cardiff Demons, Sheffield Eagles, Valley Cougars and Celtic Crusaders, Winlaton Warriors and Gateshead Spartans, as a centre, i.e. number 3 or 4, and club level rugby union (RU) for Gateshead RFC.

response: Due to the success of this great cup run, in 2001, they joined the Central South Division of the Rugby League Conference. Playing at St. Peter's RFC, a small club two miles north of the city centre, the Demons succeeded in finishing in a creditable third place and came within seconds of pulling off a major upset at Hemel Stags, only to be denied when the highly rated Stags scored a last-second try. Another notable success from the Demons’ inaugural season was the graduation of winger Jon Breakingbury on to the professional ranks when he signed for Sheffield Eagles. Their continued success inspired other clubs from around Wales to form.
